April 8, 2020

Happy Wednesday Newport Parents and Families!

Week Three of Distance Learning is complete! We miss all of our students and know that everyone is working hard to make Distance Learning successful. Your feedback is very valuable and appreciated as we navigate this process together and hope that you are all finding daily routines that work for your family.

As Thursday, April 9 and Friday, April 10 are vacation days for all school districts in Rhode Island, we hope you will take this time to recharge and enjoy your families.

If you know anyone that is still in need of technology assistance, please contact the Help Desk at 1-800-253-7122 or helpdesk@npsri.net. A Spanish Help Desk is now available and can be reached by calling 1-800-735-1775.

As we prepare for Week 4, we will reconnect with an update this Sunday, April 12. In the meantime, please continue to take care of yourself and your family and practice social distancing.

Have a wonderful long weekend, Happy Passover/Happy Easter, and stay safe!

Colleen Burns Jermain, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Newport Public Schools
